intro: Nassauvia lagascae f. glabrescens, commonly known as the smoothleaf nassauvia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. This variety is distinguished by its smooth, hairless leaves, which set it apart from other forms of the species.
